notes: This file lists commonly-observed SMART/Health attributes for drive manufacturers.
ATA/IDE/SATA/SCSI attributes use numeric attribute IDs; NVMe exposes a SMART/Health log with named fields.
Manufacturers often implement vendor-specific attributes in addition to the common ones below. For authoritative per-model lists consult vendor datasheets or smartmontools / vendor tech docs.

manufacturers.notes: This is a best-effort list of commonly observed attributes. For model-specific attribute maps consult vendor datasheets or smartmontools/CrystalDiskInfo output.

attributes.name: Read Error Rate
attributes.description: Rate of hardware read errors reported by the drive.

attributes.name: Spin-Up Time
attributes.description: Average time to spin up the drive (vendor-dependent units).

attributes.name: Reallocated Sectors Count
attributes.description: Count of bad sectors remapped to spare area.

attributes.name: Seek Error Rate
attributes.description: Rate of errors while seeking, vendor-dependent.

attributes.name: Power-On Hours
attributes.description: Total powered-on time of the drive (hours).

attributes.name: Current Pending Sector Count
attributes.description: Number of unstable sectors pending remap.

attributes.name: UltraDMA CRC Error Count
attributes.description: Count of interface CRC errors (cabling/connection issues).

attributes.name: Critical Warning
attributes.description: Composite critical warning bits (available spare, temp, reliability, read-only, volatile backup failed).

attributes.name: Available Spare Threshold
attributes.description: Threshold for available spare (below means warning).

attributes.name: Percentage Used
attributes.description: Percentage of drive life used (wear indicator).

attributes.name: Data Units Read
attributes.description: Count of host data units read (units are device-specific).

attributes.name: Data Units Written
attributes.description: Count of host data units written.
